Z nogavicami se dokazano bolje spi
Znanstvena študija je pokazala, da je spanje v nogavicah zelo priporočljivo, saj spimo globlje in dlje; pred spanjem se izogibajte topli kopeli in pametnim uram.
03 Nov 2019, 19:31 by T. H.



GETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTOTisti, ki si za v posteljo nadenejo nogavice, prej zaspijo in dlje spijo. FOTOGRAFIJE: Guliver/Getty Images



GETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTONogavice niso le razvada, ampak spalni pripomoček.



GETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTOKorejski znanstveniki so potrdili modrosti naših babic.


Ko začne pritiskati mraz, si mnogi, predvsem ženske, tudi ponoči nadenejo nogavice, da jih med spanjem ne bi zeblo. Nekateri pač ne marajo imeti mrzlih nog. Čeprav se to komu zdi nenavadno, takih ljudi sploh ni malo. Pravzaprav bi lahko rekli, da obstajata dve vrsti ljudi, prva je tista, ki spi v nogavicah, druga pa tista, ki se ji zdi to popolnoma nesmiselno. Resda je prvih veliko manj kot drugih, okoli 10 odstotkov naj bi jih bilo, a vendar se je tega fenomena lotila tudi znanost. Je to zdravo? 
Presenetljivi rezultati
S spanjem v nogavicah se je čisto zares ukvarjala znanstvena študija južnokorejskih znanstvenikov, ki sta jih vodila Yelin Ko in Joo-Young Lee z univerze v Seulu. Odrasle poskusne zajčke sta razdelila v dve skupini, ena je spala v nogavicah, druga brez. Temperatura v prostoru je bila 23 ºC, stopnja vlažnosti 50 odstotkov. Znanstveniki so nato z napravo, imenovano aktimeter oziroma aktigraf, merili dolžino in globino spanca sodelujočih, kolikokrat so se vmes prebudili in kako hitro so zaspali. Poleg tega so merili tudi nekatere telesne funkcije, kot so bitje srca, krvni tlak in temperatura.


Nogavice niso le razvada, ampak spalni pripomoček.GETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTO

Rezultati so bili presenetljivi! Izkazalo se je, da je spanje v nogavicah priporočljivo. Tisti z nogavicami so namreč zaspali 7,5 minute prej kot tisti brez njih, poleg tega so spali kar 32 minut dlje, zbujali pa so se sedemkrat manj in prav tolikokrat bolje spali. Sicer pa znanstveniki niso opazili drugih pomembnih razlik v srčnem utripu ter temperaturi teles.


Korejski znanstveniki so potrdili modrosti naših babic.GETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTO

Da nogavice ugodno vplivajo na spanec, so pravzaprav ugotovili že naši predniki. Tudi po načelih tradicionalne kitajske medicine je priporočljivo spati v nogavicah, saj hladnost v katerem koli delu telesa povzroča notranjo bolečino in odvajanje energije iz telesa. 
Zmotna prepričanja
Preverili smo še nekaj navad, za katere velja, da pomagajo pri boljšem spancu, a so se izkazale za zmotne. Mnogi so prepričani, da kozarček vina po večerji deluje uspavalno, a to nikakor ne drži. Alkohol, tudi v majhnih količinah, tik preden se odpravimo v posteljo, povzroči, da se večkrat zbudimo, mnogi zaradi tega tudi smrčijo, prav tako okrepi simptome t. i. sindroma nemirnih nog, kakršnega mnogi občutijo ponoči, med vožnjo z avtomobilom in vedno kadar mirujejo.
Spanje v nogavicah ni grda razvada, za kar jo imajo tisti, ki spijo bosi, ampak je nadvse priporočljivo.
Drugo zmotno prepričanje je, da je za dober spanec dobra topla kopel pred spanjem. A to ne drži, saj se mora naše telo za spanje shladiti, ne ogreti. Na spanje rušilno vplivajo nekatere naprave za preverjanje telesnih ritmov, na primer pametne ure in nekatere aplikacije. Stalno preverjanje krvnega tlaka, ritma srca in dolžine spanca je namreč lahko velik pritisk na možgane. Če kdo z uporabo aplikacije meri dolžino svojega spanca in ugotovi, da je spal 10 minut manj, kot bi moral, se bo ves dan spraševal, kaj naj naredi. Ta stres bo povzročil še večji stres in nespečnost bo še hujša.

Socks are proven to sleep better
A scientific study has shown that sleeping in socks is highly recommended as we sleep deeper and longer; Avoid warm baths and smart watches before bed.
03 Nov 2019, 19:31 by T.H.



GETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTOThings who put on socks for bed sooner fall asleep and sleep longer. PHOTOS: Gulliver / Getty Images



GETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTONSocks are not just a spat, but a sleeping accessory.



GETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTOKorean scientists have confirmed the wisdom of our grandmothers.


When it starts to get cold, many people, especially women, even put on socks at night to prevent them from going crazy during sleep. Some people just don't like having cold feet. Although this may seem strange to anyone, there are not many such people at all. In fact, one might say that there are two types of people, the first is the one who sleeps in the socks, and the second is the one who finds this totally pointless. Although the former are much smaller than the others, about 10 percent are supposed to be, but science has also tackled this phenomenon. Is this healthy?
Surprising results
Sleep in the socks was really about the scientific study of South Korean scientists led by Yelin Ko and Joo-Young Lee of the University of Seoul. The adult experimental bunnies were divided into two groups, one sleeping in socks, the other without. The room temperature was 23 ºC and the humidity level was 50 percent. The scientists then measured the length and depth of the subjects' sleep by using a device called an actimeter or actigraph, how many times they woke up and how fast they fell asleep. In addition, some body functions such as heart rate, blood pressure and temperature were measured.


Socks are not just a spread, but a sleeping accessory.GETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTO

The results were amazing! It turns out that sleeping in socks is advisable. Those with socks fell asleep 7.5 minutes earlier than those without them; in addition, they slept 32 minutes longer and woke up seven times less and slept much better. Otherwise, scientists have not noticed other significant differences in heart rate and body temperature.


Korean scholars have confirmed the wisdom of our grandmothers.GETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTO

In fact, our ancestors have already established that socks have a beneficial effect on sleep. Even according to the principles of traditional Chinese medicine, it is advisable to sleep in socks, as coldness in any part of the body causes internal pain and energy drainage from the body.
Misconceptions
We've tested a few more habits that are thought to aid in better sleep, but have proven to be wrong. Many are convinced that a glass of wine works dormant after dinner, but this is by no means true. Alcohol, even in small amounts, just before we go to bed, causes us to wake up several times, many of which also snore, and also exacerbates the symptoms of t. i. Restless Legs Syndrome, which many people feel at night, while driving a car and always at rest.
Sleeping in socks is not an ugly mess for those who sleep barefoot, but it is highly recommended.
Another misconception is that a good warm bath is good for bedtime. But this is not true, as our body needs to cool down, not warm up. Sleep is disrupted by some of the rhythm checking devices, such as smartwatches and some apps. Constantly checking your blood pressure, heart rate and length of sleep can put a lot of pressure on your brain. If anyone uses the app to measure the length of their sleep and find that they have slept 10 minutes less than they should, they will wonder all day what to do. This stress will cause even more stress and insomnia will be worse.
